words.example: The importance of sth. is clear to everyone.
This is very important to sb.
He gave a speech in public.
Many students volunteer to help others.
The shop is at the top of the list.
She takes a bath every day.

words.note: 名词 bath + e → 动词

words.example: This detail is relative to the topic.

phrases.example: For example, we can save energy.
She wants to talk to her teacher.
They are talking about the plan.
The teacher asked us to finish the work.
He asked his friend for help.
This rule is important for us.
They invited me to join them.
They share ideas on a website.
The name is on the top of the list.
She volunteers to work in summer.
The child has trouble in reading.

patterns.example: The air is getting more and more polluted.

patterns.pattern: It is adj. for sb. to do sth.
patterns.meaning: 对某人来说做某事是……的
patterns.example: It is essential for us to prepare well.

patterns.pattern: It is adj. to do sth.
patterns.example: It is easy to make mistakes.
Young people in the city like sports.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语
grammar.definition: 当动词以动名词形式出现并充当句子开头时，整体表示“一件事”或“一个行为”，在句中起名词作用，常用于表达一般性、抽象性的行为或习惯性动作。
grammar.structure: doing sth. + 谓语
usage: 表示抽象行为：Protecting sth. is important.
强调一件事本身：Learning English takes time.

mistakes.correct: Protecting the environment becomes important.
mistakes.explanation: 作主语时需要用动名词形式

grammar.title: 第三人称单数
grammar.definition: 当主语表示单个人、单个事物或一件事时，在一般现在时中，谓语动词需要使用第三人称单数形式。
grammar.structure: 第三人称单数主语 + 动词-s/es
usage: 描述客观事实：It works well.
描述普遍真理：Protecting sth. matters.

mistakes.correct: Protecting the environment becomes important.
mistakes.explanation: 主语是一件事，谓语动词要用第三人称单数

grammar.title: 连接词连接并列句
grammar.definition: 当表达两个完整意思时，需要使用连接词把它们连接起来，避免只用逗号导致句子结构不完整或意义不清。
grammar.structure: 句子 + and/but/so + 句子
usage: 补充说明：We save energy, and we protect nature.
表示因果：We protect sth., so life improves.

mistakes.wrong: We should protect the environment, our life will be better.
mistakes.correct: We should protect the environment, and our life will be better.
mistakes.explanation: 两个完整句子之间需要连接词

examples: We should protect nature, and it helps everyone.
He studied hard, so he passed.

grammar.title: tell / talk / speak 用法区别
grammar.definition: 这三个词都与交流有关，但侧重点不同。tell 强调传递信息并常带双宾语；talk 强调交谈过程；speak 强调说话能力或正式场合。
grammar.structure: tell sb. sth. / tell sb. to do sth.; talk to/with sb.; speak to/about sth.
usage: 传递信息：tell sb. sth.
交谈互动：talk with sb.
正式或能力：speak English

mistakes.correct: He told me to do it.
mistakes.explanation: tell 后接动作时用 to do 形式

grammar.title: tell / talk / speak / say 的区别
grammar.definition: 这四个动词都与“说”有关，但侧重点不同。tell 强调传递信息，通常需要宾语；talk 强调交谈过程；speak 强调说话的方式或语言；say 强调具体说的内容。
grammar.structure: tell sb. sth. / tell sb. to do sth.; talk to/with sb.; speak + language; say + 内容
usage: 传递信息：tell sb. sth.
互动交流：talk with sb.
语言能力：speak English
陈述内容：say that...

mistakes.correct: He told me to do it.
mistakes.explanation: tell 后接动作要用 to do 形式

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 一般过去时用于描述过去某一具体时间发生的动作或存在的状态，谓语动词需要使用过去式形式。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式
usage: 描述过去发生的动作：I ate rice yesterday.
叙述过去的经历：He gave a speech.

mistakes.correct: Yesterday I ate rice.
mistakes.explanation: 表示过去时间时动词要用过去式

grammar.title: 过去分词的三种用法
grammar.definition: 过去分词不仅可以表示完成的动作，还可以用于被动表达和充当形容词，功能比一般过去时更丰富。
grammar.structure: have/has + 过去分词；be + 过去分词；过去分词 + 名词
usage: 现在完成：have done sth.
被动表达：be done
作形容词：a broken window

mistakes.correct: The apple was eaten by me.
mistakes.explanation: 被动表达需要 be + 过去分词

examples: The eaten apple was on the table.

grammar.title: 被动语态
grammar.definition: 被动语态用于强调动作的承受者，而不是动作的执行者，常用于不知道或不强调执行者的情况。
grammar.structure: be + 过去分词 (+ by sb.)
usage: 强调结果：The work is done.
不强调执行者：The house is controlled by a system.

mistakes.wrong: The house is control by sb.
mistakes.correct: The house is controlled by sb.
mistakes.explanation: 被动语态中动词要用过去分词形式

examples: The apple is eaten by me.

grammar.title: 介词后接名词
grammar.definition: 介词后面只能接名词或名词性结构，不能直接接动词原形。如果表达动作含义，通常使用动名词形式。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词 / doing
usage: 表示方式或条件：without doing sth.
表示地点或范围：in sth.

mistakes.correct: without doing homework
mistakes.explanation: 介词后不能接动词原形

grammar.title: see 的两种宾语补足结构
grammar.definition: see 后可以接不带 to 的动词原形或动名词作宾语补足语，前者强调动作全过程，后者强调动作正在进行。
grammar.structure: see sb. do sth. / see sb. doing sth.
usage: 看到全过程：see sb. do sth.
看到正在发生：see sb. doing sth.

mistakes.wrong: I saw him to speak English.
mistakes.correct: I saw him speak English.
mistakes.explanation: see 后接动词原形不带 to

examples: I saw him enter the room.
I saw her talking with a friend.

grammar.title: ask / invite 的结构区别
grammar.definition: ask 和 invite 后接表示动作时，都使用 to do 形式，不能接 doing，因为动作尚未发生。
grammar.structure: ask/invite sb. to do sth.
usage: 请求行为：ask sb. to do sth.
邀请行为：invite sb. to do sth.

mistakes.correct: invite sb. to do sth.
mistakes.explanation: 邀请表示未发生的动作，用 to do

examples: They invited us to join them.
She asked me to stay quiet.

grammar.title: It 作形式主语的强调结构
grammar.definition: It 可作形式主语，把真正的动作放在后面的不定式中，使句子结构更平衡，常用于评价或感受。
grammar.structure: It is adj. to do sth.
usage: 表达评价：It is surprising to see sth.
强调感受：It is interesting to learn languages.

mistakes.wrong: To see him speak fluently is surprising.
mistakes.correct: It is surprising to see him speak fluently.
mistakes.explanation: 形式主语结构更自然常用

examples: It is surprising to see a child speak fluently.
It is important to prepare well.

grammar.title: to do 与 to doing 的区别
grammar.definition: 在英语中，表示将要发生或尚未发生的动作时，通常使用不定式形式；而动名词形式更偏向于名词化的动作概念。某些动词和结构只能接不定式。
grammar.structure: 动词 + to do sth.
usage: 表示将来的动作：plan to do sth.
表示目的：want to do sth.

mistakes.correct: invite sb. to do sth.
mistakes.explanation: invite 后只能接不定式表示未发生的动作

grammar.title: 介词后接名词或动名词
grammar.definition: 介词后面只能接名词或名词性结构，不能直接接动词原形；如果表示动作含义，需使用动名词形式。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词 / doing
usage: 表示方式：by doing sth.
表示条件：without doing sth.

mistakes.correct: without doing homework
mistakes.explanation: 介词后不能接动词原形

grammar.title: 一般疑问句的构成
grammar.definition: 一般疑问句通常通过把助动词或系动词提前到句首来构成，用于询问是否发生某事。
grammar.structure: 助动词/系动词 + 主语 + 动词
usage: 一般现在时提问：Do/Does + 主语 + 动词
一般过去时提问：Did + 主语 + 动词原形

mistakes.correct: Does he like apples?
mistakes.explanation: 动词原形不加变化

grammar.title: 画线部分提问的步骤
grammar.definition: 对句子中的画线部分提问时，需要先判断画线内容的类型，选择合适的疑问词，并把剩余部分改为一般疑问句语序。
grammar.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句
usage: 名词提问：What/Who + 一般疑问句
时间提问：When + 一般疑问句

mistakes.correct: What does the oven tell us?
mistakes.explanation: 一般疑问句需要助动词提前

grammar.title: 一般疑问句的构成（助动词 do）
grammar.definition: 当句子中没有系动词或情态动词时，一般疑问句需要借助助动词 do/does/did 放在句首，谓语动词还原为动词原形。
grammar.structure: Do/Does/Did + 主语 + 动词原形
usage: 一般现在时提问：Do you like music?
第三人称单数提问：Does he work here?
一般过去时提问：Did they finish it?

mistakes.correct: Does he like apples?
mistakes.explanation: 助动词出现后，谓语动词必须用原形

examples: Did he grow flowers last year?

grammar.title: 合并句子（介词 without）
grammar.definition: 使用介词 without 合并句子时，需把其中一个句子转化为名词性结构，通常去掉主语，并把动词变为动名词形式。
grammar.structure: 主句 + without doing sth.
usage: 表示否定条件：finish work without making mistakes
表示方式：solve problems without asking for help

mistakes.wrong: They cook meals without waste food.
mistakes.correct: They cook meals without wasting food.
mistakes.explanation: without 后要接动名词形式

grammar.title: 并列连词 and 的省略主语规则
grammar.definition: 当两个并列句的主语相同且语义清楚时，后一句中的主语可以省略，以避免重复。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + and + 谓语
usage: 并列动作：He came and sat down.
并列结果：She studied hard and passed the exam.

mistakes.wrong: He likes apples and he likes oranges.
mistakes.correct: He likes apples and likes oranges.
mistakes.explanation: 并列句主语相同时可省略

examples: She opened the door and walked in.
He finished his work and went home.

grammar.title: 阅读理解中的关键词定位
grammar.definition: 在阅读理解中，通过题干中的关键信息（如人物、地点、时间）回原文定位相关句子，可快速找到答案。
grammar.structure: 关键词 → 原文定位 → 比较选项
usage: 人物定位：name
地点定位：place
时间定位：time
examples: Find 'young people in the USA' in the passage.

grammar.title: 阅读理解中的信息交叉定位
grammar.definition: 当题目中同时出现两条或以上信息（如人物+时间、人物+地点）时，需要在原文中找到这些信息的交叉位置，答案通常就在该位置附近。
grammar.structure: 关键词A + 关键词B → 原文交叉点
usage: 人物+时间：name + summer
人物+地点：name + place

mistakes.wrong: 只找到一个关键词就选答案
mistakes.correct: 同时找到两个或以上关键词再判断
mistakes.explanation: 单一信息容易误选

grammar.title: 宾语从句
grammar.definition: 当一个完整的句子在主句中充当宾语时，这个句子叫作宾语从句，通常由连接词引导。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + that/wh- + 从句
usage: 陈述事实：know that...
表达信息：find out what...

mistakes.correct: We know who Jason is.
mistakes.explanation: 宾语从句语序应为陈述语序

grammar.title: 后置定语
grammar.definition: 当修饰名词的成分较复杂（如短语或从句）时，通常放在名词后面，这种修饰成分叫后置定语。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 定语（短语/从句）
usage: 介词短语后置：the apples on the tree
定语从句后置：the families that are not rich

mistakes.correct: the apples on the tree
mistakes.explanation: 复杂修饰语需后置

examples: The book on the desk is mine.
Families that need help get support.

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 用一个从句来修饰名词，这个从句叫定语从句，通常放在被修饰名词之后，用关系词引导。
grammar.structure: 名词 + that/which/who + 从句
usage: 修饰人：who/that
修饰物：that/which

mistakes.wrong: The families are not rich live here.
mistakes.correct: The families that are not rich live here.
mistakes.explanation: 需要关系词连接定语从句

examples: The people who help others are kind.
The houses that they built are cheap.

grammar.title: 双宾语结构
grammar.definition: 某些动词可以同时带两个宾语，一个表示人，一个表示事物，通常表示“把某物给某人”。
grammar.structure: 动词 + sb. + sth.
usage: teach sb. sth.
give sb. sth.

mistakes.wrong: He teaches how to build houses people.
mistakes.correct: He teaches people how to build houses.
mistakes.explanation: 人通常作间接宾语

grammar.title: 定语从句的就近修饰原则
grammar.definition: 定语从句用于修饰名词，通常紧跟在被修饰的名词之后，优先修饰最近的名词，以保证意义清晰、指向明确。
grammar.structure: 名词 + that/which/who + 从句
usage: 修饰人：the children who need help
修饰物：the books that are useful

mistakes.wrong: The teacher teaches children have trouble in reading.
mistakes.correct: The teacher teaches children who have trouble in reading.
mistakes.explanation: 缺少关系词，导致修饰关系不清

examples: She helps students who need support.
They built houses that cost less.

grammar.title: 后置定语的类型
grammar.definition: 当修饰成分较复杂时，定语会放在名词后面，常见形式包括介词短语和定语从句。
grammar.structure: 名词 + 介词短语 / 名词 + 定语从句
usage: 介词短语：the apples on the tree
定语从句：the families that are not rich

mistakes.correct: the apples on the tree
mistakes.explanation: 复杂修饰成分需要后置

examples: The room with windows is bright.

grammar.title: 翻译中的从后往前策略
grammar.definition: 当句子中包含介词、连词或从句等复杂结构时，翻译时可先处理这些修饰成分，再回到主干，有助于理解整体意思。
grammar.structure: 修饰成分 → 主干
usage: 介词短语较多的句子
包含从句的长句

mistakes.wrong: 逐词直译导致语序混乱
mistakes.correct: 先译修饰成分再译主干
mistakes.explanation: 符合英语信息结构

examples: Children with trouble in reading need help.
Houses for families that are not rich are built.

grammar.title: 动名词作主语与谓语一致
grammar.definition: 动名词短语作主语时，整体表示“一件事”，在意义上通常视为单数，因此谓语动词用第三人称单数形式。
grammar.structure: doing sth. + 谓语（三单）
usage: 抽象行为：Reading books makes progress.
习惯性行为：Studying daily helps a lot.

mistakes.correct: Reading books makes progress.
mistakes.explanation: 动名词短语作主语，谓语用第三人称单数

grammar.title: 主谓宾分析法
grammar.definition: 理解句子时先找主语、谓语和宾语，再识别修饰成分，有助于准确判断句子结构与语法形式。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 谓语 + 宾语 (+ 修饰)
usage: 写作构句
改错与选择题

mistakes.wrong: 忽略主语直接判断动词形式
mistakes.correct: 先确定主语再选动词形式
mistakes.explanation: 动词形式由主语决定
